Understanding the Path

Sikh Philosophy & Teachings

Explore the profound wisdom and timeless teachings of Sikhism that guide us toward spiritual enlightenment and service to humanity.

Core Beliefs

Universal Truth & Divine Unity

"There is but One God, His name is Truth, He is the Creator, He fears none, He is without hate, He never dies, He is beyond birth and death, by His Grace one reaches Him."
‚Äî Mool Mantar

Foundation of Faith

Sikhism teaches the values of equality, social justice, and honest living while emphasizing the importance of remembering the Divine in all aspects of life.

The path of a Sikh is one of continuous learning, spiritual growth, and selfless service to humanity, guided by the teachings of the Gurus.

Core Principles

Naam Japo

Meditation and remembrance of the Divine Name

Kirat Karo

Earning an honest living through ethical means

Vand Chhako

Sharing with others and serving the community

Five Virtues

üåü

Sat (Truth)

Living truthfully and practicing honest conduct in all aspects of life

üïäÔ∏è

Santokh (Contentment)

Finding peace and satisfaction in what we have, free from greed

üíù

Daya (Compassion)

Showing kindness and mercy to all beings, practicing empathy

üôè

Nimrata (Humility)

Living with humility and avoiding ego, serving others selflessly

‚ù§Ô∏è

Pyaar (Love)

Universal love for all creation, seeing the Divine in everyone

Waheguru
